programme.title: Landing on Mars
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Landing on Mars, S03E06, Mars sparks our curiosity like no other planet because it is so reachable. Despite having landed there, most of the information we gather is still done by instruments in the planet's orbit.

programme.title: Shore To Shore
programme.desc: The New Frontier: Shore To Shore, S02E04, Our seafaring nature has translated well to the space age, seeking to sail out into the unknown in search of riches of one kind or another.

programme.title: First Light
programme.desc: The New Frontier: First Light, S02E08, For an instrument first developed as recently as the 17th century, the telescope has travelled a long way.

STAR LIGHT, STAR BRIGHT, S05E01, The two current science missions to our star; the sun have made great leaps forward in the science of how stars work, how they generate solar winds and how they affect their orbiting planets

programme.title: PEERING INTO THE ABYSS
programme.desc: The New Frontier: PEERING INTO THE ABYSS, S05E09, Imaging a black hole was a breakthrough in astronomy, now with the new satellite IXPE high energy telescope we will be looking at some of the most dramatic, and most violent objects in the universe: Colliding Black holes and Neutron Stars.

programme.title: Tickets Please
programme.desc: The New Frontier: Tickets Please, S04E03, No spacecraft have traveled so fast or so close to a star before. It is hoped to reveal the source of the solar winds that effect us here on Earth

programme.title: Mercury Or Bust
programme.desc: The New Frontier: Mercury Or Bust, S04E01, The ESA - JAXA joint Bepi-Colombo Mission is moments away from launch.

programme.title: The Inner Worlds
programme.desc: The New Frontier: The Inner Worlds, S01E03, They orbit between us and our Star, the inner worlds; hidden within the sun's glare often only visible at sunrise or sunset.

programme.title: Fresh Eyes
programme.desc: The New Frontier: Fresh Eyes, S04E06, Two new space telescopes are in orbit and completing their shakedown; Gaia and TESS they too will be joined by the James Webb Telescope.

programme.title: Emissaries
programme.desc: The New Frontier: Emissaries, S02E06, Our solar system is vast, from our own star the Sun to Earth is nearly 150 million kilometers or 1 Astronomical Unit.

programme.title: Living Planet
programme.desc: The New Frontier: Living Planet, S03E07, With continuous observation of arth from orbit scientists have built a data set over time that reveals much about how the Earth breaths and life sustains itself on this living Planet.

programme.title: Rocky Shores / Silent Partner
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas, S01E14, See the sun, moon, planets, and galaxies through the eyes of intrepid machines that are blazing a trail across the solar system. A gateway to bold adventures, these cameras are delivering spectacular new cosmic vistas.

programme.title: Landsat
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Landsat, S04E06, Take a look at Landsat 8, the advanced planetary explorer with a 900 million dollar price tag! It is designed to peer across multiple wavelengths to reveal complex and ever-changing details that are undetectable by the human eye.

programme.title: The Hot Zone
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: The Hot Zone, S04E03, Mercury is one Earth's closest neighbors, but for centuries it eluded astronomer's best efforts to learn its secrets. But that has changed thanks to missions like Mariner and most recently, Messenger.

programme.title: Hubble's Renaissance
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Hubble's Renaissance, S02E01, Before we can reach space, we must first be able to see it. Hundreds of years ago, the simple telescope was used to give us a seemingly closer vantage. Today, we use the awe-inspiring, and super powerful, Hubble Space Telescope.

programme.title: Borderland / Mars: Red Dawn
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas, S01E15, See the sun, moon, planets, and galaxies through the eyes of intrepid machines that are blazing a trail across the solar system. A gateway to bold adventures, these cameras are delivering spectacular new cosmic vistas.

programme.title: Vesta Unveiled
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Vesta Unveiled, S03E02, With the Dawn missions exploration of the asteroid Vesta and the dwarf planet Ceres, asteroids are a hot topic. See what these incredible missions have uncovered.

programme.title: Cosmic Rainbow
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Rainbow, S02E03, In the world of astronomy, how do we overcome the limits imposed by our own eyesight? The universe comes alive by viewing the cosmos in infrared light to gamma radiation.

programme.title: Superscopes
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Superscopes, S02E02, The human eye can only see visible light, a small spectrum of electromagnetic waves. Today, we have instruments that let us perceive all wavelengths.

programme.title: Getting There
programme.desc: The New Frontier: Getting There, S02E02, Launching payloads into space is a very difficult task, historically rocket launches are the proverbial 'swords into ploughshares'.

programme.title: The Dark Side
programme.desc: The New Frontier: The Dark Side, S02E10, Perhaps that American politician was right. There are indeed things we know we don’t know.

programme.title: Orbit
programme.desc: The New Frontier: Orbit, S02E03, The International Space Station is undoubtedly the jewel in the crown of low Earth orbit; observation post, research lab and class room.

programme.title: Proving Einstein
programme.desc: The New Frontier: Proving Einstein, S04E09, Some of the proof of Einstein’s theories had long been elusive, beyond the capabilities of technology, until now.

programme.title: Set Course For Heart of the Sun
programme.desc: The New Frontier: Set Course For Heart of the Sun, S04E02, NASA’S Parker Solar Probe Mission is on its way and will be shortly followed by Europe’s Solar probe Mission.

programme.title: The Moons of Olympis
programme.desc: The New Frontier: The Moons of Olympis, S01E07, These are the the Moon's of the gas giants. Each a unique and mysterious world of its own. Some have oceans of water, geysers of Sulphur or atmospheres of plastic.

programme.title: Planet X
programme.desc: The New Frontier: Planet X, S04E04, The New Horizons mission continues deeper into space, it’s next target looming close.
MOON SHINE, S05E02, The International drive to return to the Moon is gathering pace, this multi- nation effort is readying to return, stay and utilise the Lunar assets.

programme.title: The Ice Giants
programme.desc: The New Frontier: The Ice Giants, S01E06, Beyond the asteroid belt lay the ice giants, some can be seen with the naked eye, others only glimpsed once by a passing probe.

programme.title: Next Stop Mars
programme.desc: The New Frontier: Next Stop Mars, S01E04, It has fired our imaginations for millennia, Mars, the God of War and the source of Man's science fictional demise.

programme.title: Fermi Paradox
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Fermi Paradox, S04E05, The Fermi Paradox asks the ultimate question: Given a few reasonable assumptions about the chance of life arising elsewhere in the universe and the distance between the stars, why has an alien civilization not presented itself?

programme.title: Milky Way
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Milky Way, S04E01, This episode traces our view of the Milky Way, from the mythology of ancient sky watchers to the efforts of scientists to map it from the inside out.

programme.title: Windows to Other Worlds / Fountain of Creation
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas, S01E13, See the sun, moon, planets, and galaxies through the eyes of intrepid machines that are blazing a trail across the solar system. A gateway to bold adventures, these cameras are delivering spectacular new cosmic vistas.

programme.title: Night Fire
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Night Fire, S02E05, The Northern Lights are more than just beautiful; they tell us about the make up of our planet, our sun, and may even be a signpost for the possibility of life on other planets.

programme.title: Virtual Universe
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Virtual Universe, S02E06, Our understanding of the cosmos is limited by the amount of time we have to see it. Fortunately, computer simulations can help us see how galaxies interact over millions of years, and even how dark matter structures the universe.

programme.title: Science and the Shuttle
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Science and the Shuttle, S03E05, For more than 25 years the shuttle was our ticket to space, and our laboratory in orbit. Uncover the legacy of this amazing machine, and see what lies ahead.

programme.title: Cosmic Rays
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Rays, S04E04, Cosmic rays can tell us much about the universe. They are not simply another form of light, but carriers of information about powerful and unseen processes at work thousands or even millions of light years away.

programme.title: Family Ties
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S10E18, Vala's (Claudia Black) father Jacek (guest star Fred Willard) contacts Stargate Command wishing to trade information about a series of planned attacks on Earth in exchange for sanctuary on the planet. Also starring Ben Browder and Michael Shanks.

programme.title: Dominion
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S10E19, In an elaborate plan using Vala Mal Doran (Claudia Black) as bait to capture Adria (guest star Morena Baccarin), SG-1 themselves are surprised when Ba'al (guest star Cliff Simon) intercepts Adria from under them to use in his own evil plan.

programme.title: Unending
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S10E20, With extinction imminent, the Asgard hand over all their knowledge and technology to SG-1, but not before the Ori launch an attack trying to intercede. Starring Ben Browder, Amanda Tapping, Christopher Judge, Beau Bridges, and Michael Shanks.

programme.title: Children Of The Gods (Part 1)
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S01E01, As Colonel Jack O'Neill and his team journey to Abydos to confront deadly warriors and laser-firing Death Gliders, O'Neill realizes that this new mission seems hauntingly familiar and that an old enemy has returned to take his revenge on Earth.

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S01E05, After several attacks by the Wraiths, Dr. Elizabeth Weir contemplates if there is a spy among the team, with all signs pointing to Teyla. Feeling betrayed by the team's suspicions, the Athosians move to a newly discovered land.

programme.title: Childhood's End
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S01E06, Sheppard (Joe Flanigan), Dr. Weir (Torri Higginson), and the rest of the team visit a new planet, M7G-677, where no one is older than 24 thanks to a ritual suicide that the citizens believe is keeping the Wraith at bay.

programme.title: Poisoning The Well
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S01E07, While on the planet Hoff, Dr. Beckett strives to help the Hoffans who are working on a vaccine against the Wraith. Despite the advice against taking the vaccine due to the threat of violence and high death rate, the Hoffans take the risk.

programme.title: Underground
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S01E08, The team visit the Genii, a peaceful farming community, with the goal of trading for food to allow the team to continue to survive. Things take a turn, however when they discover that the Genii are planning a massive attack against the Wraith.

programme.title: Home
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S01E09, Upon arriving at a new planet, M5S-224, the team discovers that they can gate back to Earth. The team sets out, with the intention of returning thanks to a new hyperdrive. But when the engines suddenly explode, the team deals with a new situation.

programme.title: The Storm
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S01E10, Sheppard and Teyla discover that a massive storm is approaching the city. The team must evacuate the city, and the Manarians offer to give them shelter. As they work to figure out a way to power up the shield, the city is invaded by the Genii.

programme.title: The Eye
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S01E11, Sheppard (Joe Flanigan) plays a dangerous game of cat and mouse as he attempts to regain control of Atlantis from the Genii, who have taken the city along with Weir (Torri Higginson) and McKay (David Hewlett) hostage.

programme.title: The Defiant One
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S01E12, Sheppard and McKay set out, along with two scientists, to explore when they stumble upon a distress beacon coming from a Wraith ship. When they move to investigate, they discover that the ship has been sending out it's SOS signal for 10,000 years.

programme.title: Faith
programme.desc: Stargate Universe, S01E13, Dwindling supplies, tedious routines, and low morale continue to plague the crew of the Destiny when the ship suddenly drops out of FTL and enters the orbit of an uncharted star. But, for the first time, the countdown clock doesn’t activate!

programme.title: Human
programme.desc: Stargate Universe, S01E14, Disregarding orders, Dr. Rush links himself to the Destiny’s computer via the neural interface chair, hoping it will reveal the code needed to control Destiny’s flight path. Learning of this, Col. Young struggles with letting Rush risk his life.

programme.title: Lost
programme.desc: Stargate Universe, S01E15, Trapped beneath ruins in an underground maze, some of the Destiny's crew are stranded when the ship jumps back into FTL. The situation grows even more desperate when Rush (Robert Carlyle) learns that Destiny will soon be leaving the galaxy!

programme.title: Sabotage
programme.desc: Stargate Universe, S01E16, With crew members stranded, Destiny continues to cross from the present galaxy into the next one. Unable to alter the Destiny's course, Dr. Rush calculates the Destiny will fall short of making it to the next galaxy, stranding them indefinitely.

programme.desc: Stargate Universe, S01E15, Trapped beneath ruins in an underground maze, some of the Destiny's crew are stranded when the ship jumps back into FTL. The situation grows even more desperate when Rush (Robert Carlyle) learns that Destiny will soon be leaving the galaxy!
